  • Demonstra√ß√£o com o Postman:

    • Configura√ß√£o de autentica√ß√£o com usu√°rio SAP.

    • Envio de GET, POST e PATCH utilizando exemplos pr√°ticos.

    • Extra√ß√£o e reutiliza√ß√£o do token para altera√ß√µes.

    • Organiza√ß√£o de hist√≥rico de testes para facilitar depura√ß√£o.

  • Import√¢ncia da biblioteca oficial de APIs SAP:
    K√©ssia ressaltou a relev√¢ncia de consultar a biblioteca de APIs (api.sap.com) para validar funcionalidades suportadas, identificar limita√ß√µes e obter o layout necess√°rio para especifica√ß√µes funcionais.

  • Exemplo pr√°tico de especifica√ß√£o funcional:
    A palestrante mostrou como mapear os campos de uma planilha de dados com as tags do JSON da API, facilitando o trabalho de quem ir√° desenvolver a integra√ß√£o.

  • Conclus√£o com mensagem estrat√©gica:
    K√©ssia finalizou refor√ßando que os profissionais funcionais devem desenvolver conhecimento t√©cnico b√°sico para dialogar melhor com equipes de desenvolvimento e enfrentar os desafios crescentes de integra√ß√£o em projetos SAP.

Considera√ß√µes Finais

A palestra de K√©ssia Salazar foi uma das mais relevantes para profissionais que atuam no meio funcional e buscam compreender o universo das APIs sem serem especialistas em desenvolvimento. A did√°tica acess√≠vel, os exemplos pr√°ticos e o incentivo √† autonomia t√©cnica refor√ßaram a import√¢ncia de um perfil funcional cada vez mais h√≠brido no cen√°rio SAP atual.

entry.title: #SITSP2025DEV üñ•Ô∏è IA Gen AI
entry.content:
Speaker:
@josh_bentley 
üó£Ô∏èJosh Blubeard Bentley

Josh Bentley is an SAP Developer Advocate and longtime community leader, known for his charismatic presence, approachable personality, and, of course, his bright blue beard. With a background in IT since the 1990s and a tenure at SAP beginning in 2007, Josh has worked through various phases of tech evolution‚Äîfrom managing Blackberries to promoting GenAI, Kubernetes, and containerized cloud applications. His passion lies in empowering others within the SAP community, particularly developers and functional users seeking to collaborate and grow.

Talk Description:
This session was part storytelling, part community call-to-action. Josh shared his personal career path and quirky anecdotes while diving into how SAP‚Äôs mobile, cloud, and community landscapes have changed over time. Though titled around AI, the talk emphasized the enduring value of real-life interaction, collaboration, and community-driven initiatives.

*** Link for all Sessions ***

Key Takeaways from the Talk:

  • Origin of the Blue Beard:
    Josh opened with the backstory of his iconic beard, initially dyed as a joke to prove he had "personality" on a team. The beard became a conversation starter, a branding tool, and a symbol of his open, engaging approach to tech advocacy.

  • Journey in Tech and SAP:
    Starting in IT during the 1990s, Josh joined SAP in 2007 to manage Blackberries. He witnessed the shift from resisting iPhones to embracing iPads and cloud-first tools. By 2010, SAP was rolling out thousands of iPads, marking a pivotal point in enterprise mobility.

  • Tech Evolution and BTP:
    Josh reflected on SAP‚Äôs transition through platforms like CIASE, CYO, and the evolution to SAP‚Äôs BTP (Business Technology Platform). He noted how SAP acquired niche technologies, integrated them into core offerings, and expanded their use cases globally‚Äîfrom utility pole workers to cross-network SMS translation.

  • Developer Advocacy and Red Hat Influence:
    A stint at Red Hat exposed Josh to open-source values and meritocracy. Upon returning to SAP, he began training sales teams on cloud tech and Kubernetes. His unique background positioned him to bridge the gap between enterprise solutions and hands-on community engagement.

  • Code Jam S√£o Paulo & LATAM Tour:
    The day before the SIT event, Josh hosted a Code Jam with a hands-on GenAI workshop at X Consulting‚Äôs SAP AppHaus. Participants, supported by SAP experts, experimented with SAP‚Äôs GenAI tooling and interfaces like Juel. This Code Jam was part of a larger LATAM tour spanning Lima, Mexico City, Bogot√°, and more.

  • Community and AI Reflections:
    Despite the buzz around AI, Josh cautioned against losing the human element in tech communities. AI tools can hallucinate and mislead, but it‚Äôs the SAP community‚Äîpeople answering questions, organizing meetups, and sharing insights‚Äîthat keeps the ecosystem vibrant and reliable.

  • DevToberfest and TechEd Highlights:
    Josh promoted DevToberfest, a gamified, month-long learning festival leading into SAP TechEd. It includes live sessions, tutorials, and real-time interaction with SAP experts. He also encouraged participation in DemoJam, offering free entry to TechEd Berlin for selected teams.

  • Empowering Local Engagement:
    Josh emphasized that anyone can become a local event organizer, run SITs, or host SAP meetups‚Äîno need to work for SAP. He explained how community members can access support, post events, and receive guidance to grow regional engagement.

  • Closing Thoughts:
    Concluding on a heartfelt note, Josh expressed gratitude for the Brazilian SAP community‚Äôs energy and enthusiasm. He praised the volunteer-led spirit of the S√£o Paulo SIT and reiterated his belief in learning through failure, personal storytelling, and community-building.

Final Note:
Josh Bentley‚Äôs session was a refreshing reminder that amidst fast-evolving tech trends, it‚Äôs the human connections‚Äîmentorships, meetups, and shared learning‚Äîthat sustain innovation. His message was clear: AI might assist, but it‚Äôs people who drive the SAP community forward.

entry.title: #SITSP2025DEV üñ•Ô∏è Como extrair o melhor do SAP com Fiori e personaliza√ß√µes Clean Core
entry.content:
Palestrante

üó£Ô∏èLucas Ferreira

Executivo de contas na Tachyonix, Lucas tem mais de 12 anos de experi√™ncia com SAP, tendo atuado como consultor t√©cnico e funcional, pr√©-vendas e vendedor de solu√ß√µes BTP. Hoje, ele lidera iniciativas que conectam inova√ß√£o com resultados pr√°ticos em projetos SAP.

 

Descri√ß√£o da Palestra

Nesta apresenta√ß√£o, Lucas Ferreira compartilhou como o SAP Fiori evoluiu para ser mais que uma interface amig√°vel ‚Äî ele se tornou a principal porta de entrada para inova√ß√£o e usabilidade no ecossistema SAP. Com bom humor e analogias simples, Lucas abordou como a experi√™ncia do usu√°rio pode ser transformada ao adotar Fiori de maneira estrat√©gica, e como solu√ß√µes de baixo c√≥digo (low-code) integradas ao Clean Core agilizam o desenvolvimento de aplica√ß√µes sem comprometer a governan√ßa do sistema.

*** Link com todas as palestras ***

Conte√∫do do Blog ‚Äì Resumo da Palestra

Lucas iniciou sua palestra destacando um contraste: enquanto muitos usu√°rios ainda utilizam o SAP GUI, o verdadeiro valor do SAP S/4HANA est√° em interfaces modernas e intuitivas como o Fiori. Para demonstrar isso, ele apresentou exemplos visuais e compara√ß√µes com plataformas populares como Netflix e Facebook, que se tornaram refer√™ncias de usabilidade por sua padroniza√ß√£o e simplicidade.

Ele enfatizou que o SAP Fiori:

  • √â intuitivo e padronizado, reduzindo drasticamente o tempo de ado√ß√£o por novos usu√°rios.

  • Permite combinar fun√ß√µes transacionais e anal√≠ticas em uma √∫nica interface.

  • √â hoje o principal canal para entrega de inova√ß√µes da SAP, como o assistente digital Joule.

No entanto, Lucas tamb√©m reconheceu os desafios enfrentados por empresas que precisam de processos customizados, que muitas vezes n√£o s√£o suportados pelos aplicativos Fiori standard. Foi nesse ponto que ele introduziu o conceito de Clean Core, destacando as boas pr√°ticas para desenvolvimento e extensibilidade sem comprometer o n√∫cleo do SAP.

A Tachyonix, empresa onde Lucas atua, oferece uma plataforma que permite a cria√ß√£o de apps Fiori, CDS Views e APIs OData dentro do SAP, com uma abordagem low-code, totalmente aderente ao Clean Core. Essa ferramenta reduz significativamente o tempo e o custo de desenvolvimento de aplica√ß√µes personalizadas.

Exemplos reais foram apresentados, como:

  • Apps desenvolvidos para a Vivo, com entregas 75% mais r√°pidas do que no modelo tradicional.

  • Solu√ß√µes para Suzano, Piracanjuba e Bobst, que integraram Fiori com leitura de QR code, anexos e coleta de dados em mobile.

  • Economia de quase R$ 200 mil em 6 meses pela Piracanjuba usando a plataforma da Tachyonix.

Lucas finalizou a apresenta√ß√£o com uma demonstra√ß√£o pr√°tica do ambiente da Tachyonix dentro do SAP S/4HANA, exibindo a cria√ß√£o de um app de aprova√ß√£o de pedidos de compra. Mostrou tamb√©m dashboards anal√≠ticos criados em poucos cliques, ressaltando a import√¢ncia da converg√™ncia entre dados transacionais e anal√≠ticos na jornada de transforma√ß√£o digital.

entry.title: AI-Powered Operational Excellence in Cloud ALM's Real User Monitoring
entry.content:
Introduction

In this blog we would discuss and get to know how the available Artificial Intelligence use cases can be activated and used in a customers landscape. There are various AI capability planned in SAP Cloud ALM, be it for Implementation or Operations space.

At present, specific to operations, Change point detection in Real User Monitoring is an AI feature a customer could leverage free of cost. In this blog we would discuss about "Change point detection in Real User Monitoring".

To Understand more about Real User Monitoring(RUM) please refer to https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal/real-user-monitoring.html?anchorId=section

Cloud ALM Expert Portal for operations is a one stop solution for all your Operations related asks in Cloud ALM. https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal.html

Change Point detection in Real User Monitoring(RUM)

Expert Portal for Operation defines Real User Monitoring as:

The purpose of Real User Monitoring is to provide transparency about the usage (executions) and the performance (response times) of user interactions. It supports the monitoring request executions from different platforms with a unified user experience using a common look-and-feel and handling pattern.

The basic concept is to get all user interactions and the relevant server requests which are the correlated in the Real User Monitoring application. Request executions are rated not based on fixed thresholds but on historical values.

Real User Monitoring shall help IT users and Business users to understand how often applications are executed and what is the response times for the end-users.

What is Change Point detection:

A change point for a request name signifies a notable performance shift compared to the recent past, lasting for a brief period (not just single executions). Such a change point might suggest an event that warrants closer examination.

How to activate Change Point Detection.

  1. Select Real User Monitoring card available under Operations area of SAP Cloud ALM. If you do not see RUM card, please make sure to have required authorization added to your user.

2. Make sure that data collection for the supported system is enabled.

3. Click on the system for which you want to activate ‚ÄúChange Point Detection‚Äú.

4.Activate the Change point Detection by enabling the toggle button and click on Save.

5.To see the notable performance shift compared to the recent past, on the left hand side click on Change Points.

6.Change Points are higlighted as shown in below image. Click on the Triangle to get more information about the detected change point.

7.Details about the change point.

8.You can navigate to the request using Display Requests button.

Additional Information

1. You get the option to exclude Application from this Change Point detection activation. Go to Change Point detection and then go to Excluded Applications(Custom). Click on + button to Add an entry.

2.Tab Excluded Applications(SAP managed) provide the list of applications which are excluded from this Change Point Detection.

entry.title: Summertime = time to relax? Not for us.
entry.content:
We are using today's gloomy Berlin summer weather to plan tomorrow's topics.

‚ÄúWe?‚Äù ‚Äì That's right. For a few weeks now, there have been two of us on the group's organizing team. I, Eric, am very excited to be developing the community group together with Robby and to be able to contribute my enthusiasm for SAP and the exchange of experiences.


Yesterday, the time had finally come: Robby and I were able to meet in person for the first time, with a fantastic view of the Berlin rooftops, to compare ideas and plans for the community group and discuss the first concrete activities. Be sure to mark the fourth quarter in your calendars and stay tuned!


Until then, we will use the time to grow the community with more members. Feel free to join in and share the community in your network!
We look forward to the next steps and to picking up speed together with you.

Best regards,
Eric

Sommerzeit = Zeit f√ºr Entspannung? Nicht mit uns.

Wir nutzen das tr√ºbe Berliner Sommerwetter von heute, um die Themen von morgen zu planen

‚ÄûWir?‚Äú ‚Äì richtig. Seit ein paar Wochen sind wir bereits zu zweit im Orga-Team der Gruppe. Ich, Eric, freue mich sehr, die Community-Gruppe zusammen mit Robby entwickeln und dabei meine Begeisterung f√ºr SAP und den Erfahrungsaustausch einbringen zu k√∂nnen.

Gestern war es endlich so weit: Robby und ich konnten bei traumhaftem Blick auf die Berliner D√§cher erstmalig pers√∂nlich die Ideen und Pl√§ne f√ºr die Community Gruppe abgleichen und die ersten konkreten Aktivit√§ten besprechen. Merkt euch auf jeden Fall schon einmal das vierte Quartal vor.

Bis dahin nutzen wir die Zeit, die Community um weitere Mitglieder wachsen zu lassen. Macht gern mit und teilt die Community in eurem Netzwerk!

Wir freuen uns auf die n√§chsten Schritte und gemeinsam mit euch Fahrt aufzunehmen.

Beste Gr√º√üe,
Eric

entry.title: Cloud ALM - Solving Tips for detected exceptions raised for your supported solutions
entry.content:
Introduction

In this blog we would discuss recently made available Artificial Intelligence use cases - AI-assisted resolution of detected exceptions (Solving Tips) in Cloud ALM. This feature is available in Integration and Exception monitoring for exceptions raised for a supported solution.

To Understand more about Integration and Exception Monitoring (IEM) please refer to

https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal/integration-monitoring.html 

Cloud ALM Expert Portal for operations is a one stop solution for all your Operations related asks in Cloud ALM. https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal.html

  1. AI-assisted resolution of detected exceptions (Solving Tips) in Cloud ALM

Cloud ALM‚Äôs Exception Monitoring (EM) provides an artificial intelligence assisted feature to provide problem solving tips for the raised exception.

This AI feature is available for the all the users by default without any additional configurations.  Using it customers can easily see the SAP recommended notes for the exception and have the option to directly navigate to SAP for Me to read the complete possible solution by a single click, thus reducing time and effort to resolve the problem.

  1.  To access Problem solving tips follow the steps mentioned below.

Go to Integration and Exception monitoring in Operations area.

 

2.2 Select the required system to view the raised exceptions. Selected system would be available in the screen as highlighted below. 2.3Click on the Exceptions link, in this can it is for MyS4HANA_S4D system. Number of exceptions per category would be listed per category.

2.4 Select a category like (ABAP Application Log). All the exceptions raised are listed here.

2.5 Click on an exception. Details about the exception are listed here.

2.6 Solving tips are recommended for this particular exception in the Solving Tips Tab.

2.7 You can click on the recommended note to navigate to SAP for Me to read the note.

Additional Information.

You get the option to fine tune the result by providing additional keywords.

entry.title: Extend a Custom Business Object created with Key User Extensibility using SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
This blog post covers how to setup an extension scenario from SAP S/4HANA Cloud and build Side-by-Side UI Extensions with the help of SAP Build Apps in the Business Technology Platform.

Business scenario:

A Manager wants to define business objects ‚ÄúBonus Plan‚Äù for employees. A Bonus Plan is there to save employee specific rules for bonus entitlement.

Here, with Key User Extensibility, we create a custom Business Object with a data structure, logic for data initialization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition which should have standard API operations (GET, POST, DELETE). Expose the custom business object as web service for side-by-side UI extension using Low-code No-code capabilities of SAP Build Apps. You will learn how quickly a new UI application can be developed with the no-code capabilities of SAP Build Apps. You will also find out what is the process to setup, develop and deploy a productive extension application.

Note: The maintain Bonus app shown in this blog is for educational purpose only and not meant for productive usage. It is not ensured that the data used in this extension scenario is managed in accordance with applicable legal requirements for all countries and industries and in accordance with the business needs, such as data life cycle requirements.  

Prerequisites:

  1. Subscription to SAP Build Apps on SAP BTP Sub-Account
  2. Your user needs (a) business role(s) with business catalogs Extensibility - Custom Business Objects (ID: SAP_CORE_BC_EXT_CBO), Extensibility - Custom Communication Scenarios (ID: SAP_CORE_BC_EXT_CCS) and Communication Management (ID: SAP_CORE_BC_COM) (Need to have unrestricted access if you are creating a business role and adding these catalogs).
  3. You have Created Custom Business Objects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud as per the given tutorial.                                                                

Why SAP Build Apps with SAP S/4HANA Cloud?

Create new solutions using the secure, no-code SAP Build Apps with SAP S/4HANA. Build visually and empower users to digitalise their daily work without impacting core processes. Create a personalised, accessible application that securely connects to data from SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

To extend SAP S/4HANA Cloud using SAP Build Apps, you can leverage side-by-side extensibility, which allows you to build extensions that run on SAP BTP and interact with your S/4HANA Cloud system. This approach enables you to create custom UIs, logic, and integrations without directly modifying the core S/4HANA Cloud system. 

 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Let‚Äôs start on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud side with the definition of the Custom Business Object and the communication settings.

Custom Business Object

In the Create Custom Business Objects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud tutorial group it is shown how to create a custom business object and generate a UI (user interface) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Expose Custom Business Object as External API

To integrate custom business object from SAP S/4HANA system with External Systems or Services like SAP Build Apps, as administrator you need to create a Communication Arrangement. You create a communication arrangement to enable the communication between your system and SAP Build App in BTP, and how they communicate. Communication Arrangement is formed by combining the below artifacts:

  1. Creating a Custom Communication Scenario
    The setup of the communication (inbound and outbound) between SAP S/4HANA and SAP BTP starts with the definition of a Custom Communication Scenario.
    The Custom Communication Scenario contains the information for both inbound and outbound HTTP-calls.
    • Open the app Custom Communication Scenarios in the Launchpad of the SAP S/4 HANA system and create a new Custom Communication Scenario with the name YY1_BONUSPLAN.

     

    • On the tab Inbound Services, you create an entry for your Custom Business Object: Press Add button to add inbound service ‚ÄúYY1_BONUSPLAN_CDS‚Äù and click select button. 

     

    • Press Save and Publish to finish the custom communication scenario creation.

     

  2. Creating a Communication System and User

    To enable secure communication between different systems you have to register these systems and define the user which is authorized to use the connection.

    The communication system represents the communication partner within a communication. for inbound communication, this is the external system that calls our custom Bonus plan service.

    We‚Äôll create one Communication System for all systems that want to use our service as well as the user that they‚Äôll have to use. If you want to access the custom BONUSPLAN OData service (Inbound) you also need to setup an authentication method. You can use several methods like e.g.., Basic Authentication, Certificate or OAuth.

    In this case we are choosing Basic Authentication for which you need to setup a Communication User. Open the app Maintain Communication Users from the Communication Management group and create there a new user with username, description, and password.

    • Open ‚ÄúCommunication Systems‚Äù Application.
    • Start creating a new system by executing the ‚ÄúNew‚Äù action.
    • Give following data to the new custom communication System‚Ä¶

    Note: you can replace XXX with your system ID.

    Field Label

    Field Value

    System ID

    EXTERNAL_SYSTEMXXX

    System Name

    EXTERNAL_SYSTEMXXX

    Host Name

    EXTERNAL_SYSTEMXXX

    • Scroll down to ‚ÄúUser for Inbound Communication‚Äù and start adding one by executing the ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù action.
    • In the Pop Up, use the value help to browse and select the user.

     

    • Choose the user you already created and then click OK. Your user for Inbound Communication is set up. Click on Save.

  3. Creating a Communication Arrangement for Custom Communication Scenario

Finally, a communication arrangement links the solution‚Äôs scenario with the Communication system and its user and exposes the Service to be used.

  • Open ‚ÄúCommunication Arrangements‚Äù Application
  • Start creation by executing the ‚ÄúNew‚Äù action.
  • A pop up opens in that you use the value help for Scenario first where you can select previously created Custom Communication Scenario YY1_BONUSPLAN. This will set the Scenario and default the Arrangement Name, so that you can continue the creation via ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù button.

  • In the opening Arrangement details click to browse the Communication System
  • Choose the EXTERNAL_SYSTEMXXX you created before.
  • Choosing the system will automatically set the related User as well. Click Save to finish creation
  • Copy the Service URL for the next step. Here you save the inbound service URL for the destination configuration in BTP.

 

 

 

 

 


Build Side-by-Side UI Extensibility with SAP Build Apps

SAP Build Apps enables developers to implement loosely coupled extension applications securely on top of the existing SAP solution they already have. SAP Build Apps provides drag-and-drop capabilities for Citizen developers to build enterprise-grade applications confidently, authenticate and access SAP Business Technology Platform destinations. You can preview your SAP Build Apps project as web preview and can build it to deploy on SAP Build Work Zone or Android/IOS.

Here you will learn how to use SAP Build Apps, create an app that performs all the CRU (Create, Read, Update) operations for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud BONUSPLAN API for managing the Bonus Plan for the employee.

The point of this tutorial is to show you how you would perform all the CRU (Create, Read, Update) operations, and how you would handle some of the complexities of the SAP backend APIs (e.g. strict requirements for the data and handle multiple determination) for the Bonus plan scenario.

You will create an app with 2 pages:

  • Page 1: Display all Bonus plans
  • Page 2: Manage Bonus Plan, which handles Create or Update the bonus plan for employees.

Create destination to SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.   

In the SAP BTP cockpit, as administrator you need to create a destination to enable the communication to the S/4HANA Cloud system. In addition, the destination must be enabled for use in SAP Build Apps.

Procedure:

In the SAP BTP cockpit, navigate to your subaccount.

Choose Connectivity > Destination > Create Destination.

Choose Blank Template and enter the following data and click on Save.

Field

Value

Name

Enter the destination name.

Type

Select HTTP.

Description

Enter a description (SAP Build Apps to ABAP Callback Destination)

URL

Enter the Service URL saved during Communication Arrangement creation. If not saved access the communication arrangement

Proxy Type

Internet

Authentication

Select BasicAuthentication.

User

(Inbound) communication user used in the communication arrangement

Password

Set the password to the secret. Password of the (inbound) communication user used in the communication arrangement.

Additional Properties

Add the following properties:

‚ÄúBuildApps.RequiresCsrf‚Äù ‚Üí true

‚ÄúAppgyverEnabled‚Äù ‚Üí true

‚ÄúHTML5.DynamicDestination ‚Äù ‚Üí true

Save your entries.

 

 

 

 

 

 


Open SAP Build Apps

Open SAP Build Apps, by going to the SAP BTP cockpit, and under Instances and Subscriptions, click SAP Build Apps.

 

In the lobby of your SAP Build Apps, click Create.

 

Select Application.

 

Select Frontend and followed by this Select Web & Mobile Application and press Next button. Please note that the user needs to have access to the Custom Identity Provider to be able to create a Web & Mobile Application.

For the project name, enter Bonus plan Management and description as ‚ÄúExtend a key user extension from S/4HANA Cloud public edition ‚Äúthen click Create.

 

Connect to the REST API from the Custom Business Object on S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In this step, you will make a connection to the BONUSPLAN API of your SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. You will enable entities: BONUSPLAN (the header for a BONUSPLAN)

  1. Go to the Integrations tab.
  2. Click Add Integration.
  3. Click BTP Destinations, and then select the destination to your SAP S/4HANA Cloud BONUSPLAN API which you have created in ‚ÄúCreate destination to SAP S/4HANA Cloud system‚Äù section.
  4. Select Click Install Integration (upper right).
  5. Under Data Entities, scroll down so you can see both YY1_BONUSPLAN and I_Currency. For each, select it and click Enable Data Entity.
  6. You can now select an entity and click Browse Real Data to see live data from SAP S/4HANA Cloud.


  7. Click Save (upper right).



Create page for displaying BONUSPLANs (Homepage)

Now you will create the home page that displays a list of Bonus Plans, for which the user can update the existing Bonus Plan and can create a new Bonus Plan.

  • You will already have a Home Page. Click on it.
  • Click Variables ‚Üí Data Variables and create a data variable based on YY1_BONUSPLAN.

 

  • Click the User Interface tab to return to the UI canvas. 
  • Add a Title field and a Text field. Set the content for the text component as ‚ÄúBonus plan details‚Äù and add a button with value ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù value and list item component.


 

 

  • Add a List Item component

 

  • Click the list item, and configure its properties as follows:

Property

Value

Repeat with

data variable YY1_BONUSPLAN1

Primary label

data item in repeat current.EmployeeName

Secondary label

data item in repeat current.EmployeeID

 

Now you can test the application which should display the Bonus list by saving your changes and clicking on Preview to preview the application.

Hopefully you got this far and found success! Congratulations!!!

 

You will define the logic for the list item selection later once we finish next step (Create page for Manage Bonus Plan)

  • With the list item selected, open the logic canvas.
  • Add an Open page flow function, and configure it as follows:

  • Drag and drop an Open page flow function, and configure it as follows: Make sure that don‚Äôt bind any value to the page parameter of Manage Bonus Plan and Page value as ‚ÄúManage Bonus Plan‚Äù.


Create page for Manage Bonus Plan

You will create a page for Manage Bonus Plan.

  • Click Add New Page, enter Manage Bonus Plan, and click OK.
  • Navigate to page Manage Bonus Plan
  • Click PAGE PARAMETERS and two parameter such as EmployeeName of type Text and SAP_UUID of type UUID.

 

 

  • Click Data Variables and create a variable for YY1_BONUSPLAN and Data Variable Type as ‚ÄúSingle data record‚Äù and bind SAP_UUID value to the page parameter SAP_UUID.

 

 

  • Click View to return to the UI canvas and remove all the default components.

Save

 

Add logic to Add/Update Bonus Plan:

  1. Now we will add the logic to the Save button. To achieve this, click on Save button and open its logic canvas.
  2. Add logic flow functions and connect them as in the following:
  3. Configure the flow functions as follows:
  • IF condition (first): Set the condition to the following formula (validates the SAP_UUID field):
    NOT(IS_NULLY(params.SAP_UUID))

Update record: Set the following:

  • Resource name: YY1_BONUSPLAN1
  • Risk ID: page parameter SAP_UUID
  • Record: Set the following formula (allows us to make sure the integer fields receive a number value):

{ ValidityStartDate: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.ValidityStartDate, ValidityEndDate: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.ValidityEndDate,LowBonusAssignmentFactor: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.LowBonusAssignmentFactor,HighBonusAssignmentFactor:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.HighBonusAssignmentFactor,LowBonusPercentage_V: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.LowBonusPercentage_V, HighBonusPercentage_V:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.HighBonusPercentage_V, EmployeeID: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.EmployeeID,  EmployeeName: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.EmployeeName, TargetAmount_V:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.TargetAmount_V, TargetAmount_C:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.TargetAmount_C}

 

Create record: Set the following:

  • Resource name: YY1_BONUSPLAN1
  • Record: Set the following formula:

{ SAP_UUID: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.SAP_UUID, ValidityStartDate: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.ValidityStartDate, ValidityEndDate: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.ValidityEndDate,LowBonusAssignmentFactor: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.LowBonusAssignmentFactor,HighBonusAssignmentFactor:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.HighBonusAssignmentFactor,LowBonusPercentage_V: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.LowBonusPercentage_V, HighBonusPercentage_V:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.HighBonusPercentage_V, EmployeeID: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.EmployeeID,  EmployeeName: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.EmployeeName, TargetAmount_V:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.TargetAmount_V, TargetAmount_C:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.TargetAmount_C}

 

You can set the Toast and Alert flow functions for both Create record and Update record with the appropriate Text message to inform the user about the success or error message during Save.

Now you can now test the application, which is designed to display all available Bonus plans. If you select an existing Bonus Plan, the system will load all relevant field values for the chosen employee, allowing you to update those details. Additionally, you can create a new Bonus Plan by using the Create button and by following the steps mentioned in the section Test app.

Thanks, you have completed SAP Build Apps application development by extending a Custom Business Object successfully! üòäCongratulations!!!

Test app

  • Open the Preview Portal using the Preview button located in the top-right corner.
  • Go to the Launch tab, then Open Preview Portal, then Web Preview.

 

  • Click Bonus Plan to open the app. You should see the first page with a list of Bonus Plan in the first page and while navigating to the Manage Bonus Plan page handles Create or Update the bonus plan for employees.

For Deploying an app created with SAP Build Apps to HTML5 applications repository on SAP BTP and Integrate an SAP Build Apps application into SAP Build Work Zone, please do refer to this tutorial.
